  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises
PROFIL RECHERCHE
Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :
  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.
PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT
  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence
Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !
PACKAGE SALARIAL
Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité
👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération
Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.
LES PETITS PLUS
🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The company and our mission:




Zartis is a digital solutions provider working across technology strategy, software engineering, and product development.




We partner with firms across financial services, MedTech, media, logistics technology, renewable energy, EdTech, e-commerce, and more. Our engineering hubs in EMEA and LATAM are full of talented professionals delivering business success and digital improvement across application development, software architecture, CI/CD, business intelligence, QA automation, and new technology integrations.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to work on a project in the home energy optimization industry.







The project:




Our teammates are talented people that come from a variety of backgrounds. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture based on trust and innovation which creates a good work environment that helps enrich the product.

You will be part of a distributed team developing new technologies to solve real business problems.

Our client is a climate-tech startup on a mission to make rooftop solar more effective and affordable building a platform that optimizes home energy storage using real-time data and machine learning to reduce carbon emissions lower costs and make solar accessible to more households recently closed its seed round and rolling out to early users offering a remote-first setup with flexibility a small and ambitious team where early hires have real ownership and impact.




We are looking for someone proactive with strong communication skills and attention to detail, motivated by climate impact and data-driven solutions.




The Role:




We're looking for a Data Analyst to join our client’s founding team and take a leading role in how we manage, interpret, and leverage data across our client’s platform.




You'll work closely with engineering, product, and leadership to monitor and refine our optimisation models, deliver insights to enhance customer outcomes, and drive strategic decision-making. As one of our client’s first data-focused hires, you'll have significant autonomy and influence. Youʼll work with the Head of Product to define best practices for data analysis and monitoring, design performance metrics, and work across technical and business domains to ensure that data remains a core strength of our client company.




What you will do:




Leading the analysis of large, complex time-series datasets from a range of sources (energy storage systems, home appliances, environmental data).
Monitoring the performance of our optimisation and forecasting models, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.
Designing, implementing, and owning key performance indicators KPIs to track customer outcomes and system performance.
Rapidly diagnosing and investigating customer-facing or system issues using a data-driven approach.
Supporting and enhancing the development of new models for forecasting, optimisation, and predictive analytics.
Collaborating closely with engineering and product teams to turn analysis into action.
Providing input into business and product strategy based on data insights and emerging trends.
Helping to shape data processes, tooling, and culture as we scale.




What you will bring:




Ideally, 4 years of experience in a data analysis, data science, or analytics engineering role.
Advanced SQL skills and extensive experience working with relational databases (e.g., Cloud SQL, BigQuery).
Proficient in Python for data analysis Pandas, NumPy, Jupyter, etc.).
Significant experience working with complex time-series datasets.
Strong understanding of either linear optimisation techniques or machine learning for predictive analytics.
Demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights for technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving instincts and an intuitive grasp of real-world system behaviours reflected in data.
Self-directed and comfortable taking ownership in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment.
Excellent communication skills and a collaborative, low-ego approach.
Motivated by climate impact and passionate about building real-world solutions.




Nice to Have:




Experience working in energy systems/utilities or with smart/IoT devices.
Experience in early-stage startups or small cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with cloud-native data tooling (Google Cloud Platform preferred).
Experience establishing data monitoring and reporting frameworks from Scratch.




What we offer:




100% Remote Work
WFH allowance: Monthly payment as financial support for remote working.
Career Growth: We have established a career development program accessible for all employees with a 360º feedback that will help us to guide you in your career progression.
Training: For Tech training at Zartis, you have time allocated during the week at your disposal. You can request from a variety of options, such as online courses (from Pluralsight and Educative.io, for example), English classes, books, conferences, and events.
Mentoring Program: You can become a mentor in Zartis or you can receive mentorship, or both.
Zartis Wellbeing Hub (Kara Connect): A platform that provides sessions with a range of specialists, including mental health professionals, nutritionists, physiotherapists, fitness coaches, and webinars with such professionals as well.
Flexible Working schedule.
Multicultural working environment: We organize tech events, webinars, parties, and activities to do online team-building games and contests.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the Role




We’re looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team and play a key role in shaping data-driven decision-making across the company. Reporting directly to the management team, you will work with large and complex datasets to uncover insights that drive strategic initiatives in marketing, product, and operations.




You’ll use tools like SQL, Tableau, or Power BI to conduct deep analyses, build revenue models, and identify performance trends. Your ability to connect data across business functions and translate it into actionable insights will be essential to optimizing revenue and business performance.




This is a remote position and can be based anywhere, as long as you are legally authorized to work in your country of residence. However, you must be available to work full-time during Dubai working hours (9AM to 6PM Gulf Standard Time).




If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, enjoy solving complex problems, and want to make a measurable impact role is for you.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather, cleanse, and analyze data for accurate and timely reporting.
Deliver weekly and monthly reports with clear insights, takeaways, and recommendations for leadership.
Proactively identify performance discrepancies or potential issues through your analysis and reporting.
Work closely with management to identify and communicate key improvement areas across the business, with a strong focus on revenue optimization.
Build and maintain revenue models and forecasts to support strategic planning.
Analyze key growth metrics such as user behavior, conversion rates, churn, ARPU, CAC, and LTV.
Identify opportunities to increase revenue and improve operational efficiency.




Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years in a similar role (e.g., Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst), ideally within a fast-paced environment.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.




Technical Skills

Strong proficiency in SQL or similar data query languages.
Proven experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with cloud technologies; AWS experience is a plus.




Additional Skills

Comfortable working with large, complex datasets across multiple sources.
Strong problem-solving skills and a highly analytical mindset.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical stakeholders.
A deep understanding of core revenue metrics (LTV, CAC, churn, ARPU) and their impact on business performance.




Why Join Us?

This is your opportunity to drive meaningful change through data. You’ll have visibility at the leadership level and the chance to shape decisions that directly impact the company’s growth. We value curiosity, ownership, and a passion for using data to unlock business potential.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 51.000 colleagues in nearly 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you’ll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you’ll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria’s diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Analyst.
You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data transformation, data foundation, and more
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria’s portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You collect, analyze and match customer demand with meaningful data
You have knowledge and experience with databases and data modeling
You have good knowledge and experience with SQL
Knowledge of a programming language like Python is a plus
You have analytical thinking, communication skills and a practical attitude.
You are proficient in English; knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a must.


What We Can Offer You

Become part of a major Tech player in Europe that is recognised for consulting, digital services and software development. Work among high-level professionals who dare to make bold choices to deliver results.

Additionally, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Are you ready to further develop your career? Then we’d love to point you in the right direction. With offices in more than 30 countries, that direction might lead you to places you’ve never been to before. Would you prefer to grow internally? That’s possible, too. We challenge you to keep pushing yourself to become the best you can be.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


Ready to take the next step?

We’re here to support you all the way and we are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission Overview:

Keystone Solutions is seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a consultancy mission at our client site in the energy domain in Brussels. The successful candidate will perform their responsibilities as a Keystone Solutions consultant, working closely with the client to drive impactful data analysis and decision-making.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze and interpret complex data sets related to energy operations.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand user stories and requirements.
Work on different user stories in parallel to ensure timely delivery of insights.
Design and implement data models, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings.
Contribute to data strategy development and optimization of data processes.
Support the team in identifying data trends and providing actionable recommendations.



Consultancy Nature of Work:

This position offers the opportunity to work as a consultant directly at the client's location, allowing for a hands-on approach to data analysis within a dynamic consultancy framework.

Dynamic Projects:

The candidate will engage with diverse challenges across various client projects, leveraging their expertise to provide tailored data solutions.

Turbo-Charged Learning and Development:

Keystone Solutions invests in the professional development of its consultants, providing broad learning experiences that elevate career trajectories.

Ambition Skyrocketing within a Consultancy Framework:

Working as a consultant at Keystone Solutions means having access to varied client engagements that foster career growth and skill enhancement.

Emphasizing Keystone Solutions’ Values in a Consultancy Context:

At Keystone Solutions, our core values shape every consulting engagement, ensuring that our consultants—notably referred to as “K-Stones”—bring integrity, excellence, and innovation to every client project.

Role-Specific Enhancements Reflecting Consultancy Work:

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will apply your expertise in data analysis across multiple client scenarios, enriching your experience and enhancing your skillset.

If you are ready to tackle technical and strategic challenges in a dynamic consultancy environment, apply today at Keystone Solutions Career Portal.

At Keystone Solutions, our core values shape every consulting engagement, ensuring that our consultants—notably referred to as “K-Stones”—bring integrity, excellence, and innovation to every client project.

Role-Specific Enhancements Reflecting Consultancy Work:

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will apply your expertise in data analysis across multiple client scenarios, enriching your experience and enhancing your skillset.

If you are ready to tackle technical and strategic challenges in a dynamic consultancy environment, apply today at Keystone Solutions Career Portal.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Yuki & The Yuki Way

Hi there, welcome to Yuki! As a vibrant, international IT scale-up, we support accountants, businesses, and entrepreneurs in handling their accounting more efficiently, simply, and enjoyably. And to make that possible? Well, we’re looking for kick-ass colleagues to complete our ambitious, cheerful, and lively team of top professionals!

Come on, now: that sounds like something for you, right?


Your Role at Yuki

Yuki is on a journey to enhance its analytics efforts and transform into a more data-driven organization. Our commitment to this goal has led us to implement a variety of advanced cloud data platforms and reporting tools to enhance our analytics capabilities. While acquiring the right technology is a significant step, the true success of our analytic initiatives depends on having the right people in place. That’s why we need you! By unlocking the power of our data, you'll help shape business strategies and drive growth, innovation, and success.




Drive Data-Backed Decisions: Partner with product, marketing, sales, and customer success teams to identify key business questions and provide actionable insights.

Product & Customer Analytics: Analyze user behavior and product engagement metrics (activation, retention, churn, expansion) to help shape product strategy and improve user experience.

Report and Dashboard Development: Create and refine reports and dashboards that while remaining user-friendly, aiding the business in making informed decisions. Work in collaboration with stakeholders throughout the company to fully understand their requirements.

Data Delivery: Link and integrate various data sources, such as sales, marketing, product, and finance data, to extract and present new insights. Ensure all reported metrics come from a single source of truth.

Data Landscape Development: Oversee the evolution of our data landscape by mapping data processes and keeping guides up-to-date, ensuring all team members can navigate our evolving data environment efficiently.

Initiative in Systems and Technology Implementation: Take a proactive role in implementing new systems and technologies, ensuring our data strategies remain cutting-edge and align with organizational goals.


What we are looking for

For this position, we're looking for someone who isn't afraid to dive deep into data, turning those numbers into actionable insights and identifying trends and anomalies to help us reach our business objectives!




Minimum of 3 years relevant experience

The desire to work on Data and/or Business Analytics.

Analytically strong, this is evident from your experiences.

Experience with complex information systems and reporting environments.

Knowledge of, and experience with, transforming and analyzing data (e.g. in data warehouses with SQL).

Knowledge of and experience with setting up reports and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI).

Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken (Dutch is a nice-to-have).





Very Important: What's in It for You

At Yuki, we believe in empowering our team so they can empower our users. Here’s what we offer:

Competitive Package: A one-year contract with attractive additional benefits such as healthy lunches and lifestyle coaches.

Development Budget: Benefit from a generous training budget available from day one;

Flexible Work-Life Balance: Hybrid working is supported - but we also encourage you to come to the office;

Plenty of Opportunities: Be part of the global Visma-group in an established enterprise with a scale-up mentality;

Cool Events: Participate in numerous events focused on networking, learning, and sports;

Be Part of the Yuki Family: Immerse yourself in our diverse, international team (with offices in Rotterdam, Antwerp, and Barcelona);

Atmosphere! For us, it's all about atmosphere, from team building to Friday drinks. Expect a dynamic buzz combined with competitive ping pong!


What Does the Application Process Look Like?

Apply: Apply now! We will contact you as soon as possible.

Get to Know Us: Meet us through our Talent Acquisition Team.

Business Case: Prepare and work on our business case.

Second Interview: Discuss the business case at our office with the CFO and Senior Data Analyst.

Third Interview: Meet our HR Manager

Offer: If we see a match—you'll receive an offer!

Show more

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Function

Advisory - Advisor

Roles & Responsibilities

At KPMG, we believe in harnessing the power of data to drive better business decisions. Our team of consultants works alongside clients to help them transform raw data into actionable insights that fuel strategic growth. As a global leader in audit, tax, and advisory services, we combine deep industry expertise with cutting-edge technologies to deliver innovative solutions.

Role Overview

As a Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant, you will play a key role in helping our clients unlock the potential of their data. You will work on a variety of projects across different industries, focusing on improving decision-making processes, enhancing reporting capabilities, and developing data-driven strategies. You will collaborate closely with both internal teams and clients to ensure that data is collected, structured, and visualized in a way that drives value.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with clients to understand their data challenges and business objectives
Design and implement BI solutions, including dashboards and reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and optimize data models
Conduct data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights
Provide recommendations to improve data management and reporting processes
Stay updated with the latest BI tools and technologies
Contribute to project management by ensuring timely and quality delivery


Location

Zaventem HQ

Skills & Qualifications


Strong experience in data analysis, reporting, and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) Proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques
Ability to translate complex data into clear and actionable insights
Good communication skills to interact effectively with clients and teams
A passion for problem-solving and a detail-oriented approach
Team player with a collaborative mindset
Willingness to learn and adapt to new challenges
A good communication knowledge of Dutch & English


We offer


A corporate culture in which personal growth, mutual trust and lifelong learning are being fostered.
An inclusive workspace that encourages diversity and pursues mutual respect for each other’s beliefs and background.
Professional experiences in an international and dynamic working environment with inspiring colleagues.
Flexible, hybrid work arrangements to enable working on different locations: home office, on-site or on the go.
A wide range of teambuilding activities and social events that enable new joiners to meet colleagues within the wider KPMG community and have some fun along the way.

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if …




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant







Who We Are:

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.




The Opportunity:

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.




Responsibilities:

Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank’s digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization










Your Profile:

Master’s degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.




What We Offer:

Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.




Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?




Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‘Data analytics expertise centre’




WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?




The ‘Data analytics expertise centre’ occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.




WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?




You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.




WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?




A Master’s degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline); a doctorate is an asset.
Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.




WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?




A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Flexible working hours.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Opportunities for internal mobility.
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.




Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
HAYS IT is assisting one of their clients in the telecommunications industry in their search for a freelance Data Analyst. The company is located in Mechelen.




Key Responsibilities:

Maintain and enhance commission calculation systems using sales and HR data.
Ensure accurate monthly closings and data delivery to HR and financial systems.
Support business stakeholders with inquiries related to commission plans.
Conduct ad hoc analyses and validate data flows.
Utilize the Varicent tool for sales performance management.
Collaborate with fellow analysts to support various sales channels.
Participate in cross-functional projects bridging business and IT.




The ideal candidate has:

A Master’s degree in Business Engineering, Applied Economics, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
2–3 years of experience in data analysis using tools such as Qlik, Power BI, or Tableau.
Proficiency in SQL and data modeling.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Experience with sales or commission data is a plus.
Fluency in Dutch and English.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.




Nice to have:

Experience with Varicent or similar sales performance tools.
Presentation and PowerPoint skills.
Background in Telecom or related industries.
Coaching or mentoring experience.




Benefits:

Long-term freelance opportunity.
Hybrid working model.
Work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.
Opportunity to contribute to impactful business decisions.




If you are interested, please contact Ivie, Hays IT via ivie.bawin@hays.com or on +32 (0) 3 302 07 03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Votre mission

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

Vos responsabilités

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

Daily: 


You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.
Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.
You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.


Vos atouts

Your Profile As a Data Analyst


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management. 
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus. 
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. 
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure. 
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).


Notre offre


A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Location : Brussels.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.


Vous voulez participer au succès de Partenamut ?

Click on "apply" to access our online application form.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Vacature Ervaren Data Analist




Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.




Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.




Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:

Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis




Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z’s.




Een greep uit je takenpakket:

Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega’s.




Jouw profiel:

Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, …
Ervaren in SQL en ETL-processen
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie




Dit krijg je van ons

In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega’s. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.




Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe ideeën: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken
Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologieën: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!




Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be




Diversiteit, inclusie en gelijkheid

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI-expert
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een toonaangevend Belgisch data-intelligencebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring in business intelligence en data-analyse. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner beschikken we over diepgaande expertise in Microsoft BI, Data Governance en meer.




Met een team van meer dan 120 gepassioneerde consultants ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun volledige datatraject — van strategie tot implementatie. Wat ons uniek maakt? Onze focus op langetermijnrelaties en een bedrijfscultuur waar plezier en professionaliteit hand in hand gaan.




Door de groei van ons klantenportfolio en nieuwe boeiende projecten zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Power BI-professional die samen met ons team impactvolle end-to-end dataoplossingen wil realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in (toegepaste) informatica of een verwante richting.
Je hebt een analytische geest en denkt oplossingsgericht.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, DAX en Python.
Je hebt kennis van datamodelleringstechnieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen: je beheerst DAX, datamodellering én custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory en/of Databricks.
Weet hoe je efficiënt werkt met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Sterk communiceert en graag samenwerkt in teamverband.
Vloeiend bent in zowel Nederlands als Engels.




Ons aanbod

Of je nu werknemer of freelancer bent, wij staan open voor samenwerking.
Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met uitstekende extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfwagen etc.
Je krijgt ruimte voor persoonlijke en professionele groei via opleidingen en certificeringen.
Je werkt aan uitdagende en innovatieve projecten binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem.
Je wordt deel van een warme en dynamische bedrijfscultuur, met aandacht voor fun: van familiedagen en sportactiviteiten tot onze jaarlijkse skitrip en gezellige spelavonden.




Klaar om jouw carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef je datatalent de ruimte die het verdient.

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt ernaar uit om jou te leren kennen!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your responsibilities:




Understand Business Needs: Gain a deep understanding of the workflows and objectives of EUDA teams to deliver tailored solutions.
Interactive Decision Trees: Create user-friendly decision trees to help users select the most appropriate EUDA tools.
Efficient Processes: Develop streamlined processes for handling new EUDA requests and incidents.
Expert Advice: Provide strategic direction and expert advice to optimize EUDA operations.
Data-Driven Decisions: Monitor and analyze the use of EUDA tools to enable informed decision-making.
Training Facilities: Establish comprehensive training programs for end-users of EUDA technologies.
Community Building: Foster a strong EUDA community, encouraging collaboration and peer support.




What we're looking for:




Communication & Collaboration: Excellent skills in both areas.
Conceptual Thinking: Ability to outline processes fluently.
Empathy & Solutions: Seek win-win solutions with a critical and constructive approach.
Inspiration & Confidence: Inspire others and instill confidence.
Team Player: Transparent interaction and strong teamwork.
Persuasive Storytelling: Use your storytelling skills to persuade and engage.
Commitment & Responsibility: Fully committed with a great sense of responsibility.

Title: Data Analyst Reporting Automotive
Description:
Fonction




En tant que Data Analyst, vous avez, au sein du département Reporting Automotive, la charge de comparer des données (Clients, Compagnies, Internes), d’analyser et interpréter les résultats afin d’établir des rapports personnalisés pour nos clients ou partenaires. Vous jouez un rôle clé car vous serez garant de la qualité des données et serez souvent amené à travailler avec plusieurs équipes (Sinistres, IT, Production, Clients Manager, Comptabilité)




Vos tâches sont diversifiées:




Vous créez, administrez et modélisez les rapports et vous vous assurez de livrer les données nécessaires selon les deadlines fixées.
Vous avez la charge du traitement, de l’exploitation des données dans notre système interne.
Vous traitez des données provenant de systèmes partenaires (Ubench, Fixico)
Vous aidez à la mise en place des nouveaux process et vous assurez le maintien à jour des process existants
Vous utilisez ou gérez le planning de l’équipe
Vous assurez la livraison des différents jobs opérationnels




Profil




Vous avez obtenu un Bachelier (ou équivalent par expérience).
Vous avez de préférence une première expérience en assurance Automobile.
Vous parlez couramment le français et avez une bonne maitrise du néerlandais. L’anglais est un atout.
Vous maitrisez bien la suite Office et en particulier Excel (Niveau avancé).
Vous connaissez et pouvez utiliser les outils « Power Tools ».
Vous avez un esprit analytique, vous êtes à l'aise avec les chiffres et le traitement des données.
Vous pouvez travailler seul ou en équipe.
Vous êtes organisé(e) et avez une bonne gestion des priorités.




Intéressé(e) ?




Voulez-vous en savoir plus sur Aon et ce poste ? Postulez chez le leader du marché pour un emploi dynamique avec des opportunités d'apprentissage et de croissance ainsi qu'un package salarial compétitif.




-----




Functie




Als Data Analyst binnen de afdeling Reporting Automotive ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergelijken van gegevens (klanten, bedrijven, intern), het analyseren en interpreteren van de resultaten om gepersonaliseerde rapporten op te stellen voor onze klanten of partners. Je speelt een sleutelrol omdat je verantwoordelijk bent voor de kwaliteit van de gegevens en vaak zal samenwerken met verschillende teams (Claims, IT, Productie, Client Manager, Boekhouding).




Je taken zijn gevarieerd:




Je maakt, beheert en modelleert rapporten en zorgt ervoor dat de benodigde gegevens volgens de vastgestelde deadlines worden geleverd.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de verwerking en exploitatie van gegevens in ons interne systeem.
Je verwerkt gegevens afkomstig van partnersystemen (Ubench, Fixico).
Je helpt bij het implementeren van nieuwe processen en zorgt voor het up-to-date houden van bestaande processen.
Je gebruikt of beheert de planning van het team.
Je zorgt voor de levering van verschillende operationele taken.




Profiel




Je hebt een Bachelor diploma (of gelijkwaardig door ervaring).
Je hebt idealiter een eerste ervaring in autoverzekeringen.
Je spreekt vloeiend Frans of Nederlands en hebt een goede beheersing van de tweede taal. Engels is een pluspunt.
Je beheerst de Office-suite goed, vooral Excel (gevorderd niveau).
Je kent en kunt de "Power Tools" gebruiken.
Je hebt een analytische geest, bent goed met cijfers en gegevensverwerking.
Je kan zelfstandig of in teamverband werken.
Je bent georganiseerd en je kan goed je prioriteiten stellen.




Interesse?




Wil je meer weten over Aon en deze vacature? Solliciteer bij de marktleider naar een dynamische baan met leer-en groeimogelijkheden en een competitief salarispakket.







2559877

HTML:
Fonction


En tant que Data Analyst, vous avez, au sein du département Reporting Automotive, la charge de comparer des données (Clients, Compagnies, Internes), d’analyser et interpréter les résultats afin d’établir des rapports personnalisés pour nos clients ou partenaires. Vous jouez un rôle clé car vous serez garant de la qualité des données et serez souvent amené à travailler avec plusieurs équipes (Sinistres, IT, Production, Clients Manager, Comptabilité)


Vos tâches sont diversifiées:


  • Vous créez, administrez et modélisez les rapports et vous vous assurez de livrer les données nécessaires selon les deadlines fixées.
  • Vous avez la charge du traitement, de l’exploitation des données dans notre système interne.
  • Vous traitez des données provenant de systèmes partenaires (Ubench, Fixico)
  • Vous aidez à la mise en place des nouveaux process et vous assurez le maintien à jour des process existants
  • Vous utilisez ou gérez le planning de l’équipe
  • Vous assurez la livraison des différents jobs opérationnels

  • Vous avez obtenu un Bachelier (ou équivalent par expérience).

  • Vous connaissez et pouvez utiliser les outils « Power Tools ».

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Your role as a Data Strategist lies in guiding our clients to become increasingly data-driven. You strive to connect (top) management, data teams and analytical teams with your analytical translation skills. You would build the business case for data & AI use cases and ensure that value creation is top priority in data roadmaps and throughout data projects execution. In addition, you work towards an improved organizational setup around data and install scalable data processes. Moreover, you contribute to creating a data-driven culture where people embrace data and its possibilities. In this role, you will operate with our current clients in rapidly changing environments on a medium to long-term basis or would develop the data strategy of organizations that prioritize their investments in data for the foreseeable future.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have 3 or more years of relevant experiences in data & analytics domain. Strategic or management consulting background is a big plus
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information and to turn this information into value
You are not necessarily a data scientist by background, but have reasonable high-level knowledge of different data-related domains such as business intelligence, analytics, data science, information management and data infrastructure. This includes understanding of market trends in tooling, data engineering and governance best practices and basic statistical knowledge
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results
You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You create easy connections with stakeholders throughout organization
Experience with leading data projects is a plus.
All candidates need very good knowledge of English. Knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
📄 Type: Full-time | 📊 Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn’t be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data—we turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium’s leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn’t just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let’s talk.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
📊 Vacature: Freelance Data Analyst




Wat?

Je analyseert complexe datasets en vertaalt deze naar heldere inzichten.
Je ontwikkelt dashboards en rapporten in Power BI en/of Tableau die stakeholders ondersteunen in hun beslissingen.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategieën te ondersteunen.
Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft efficiënte SQL-query’s om de juiste informatie boven te halen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.
Je bent sterk in SQL en weet hoe je data uit verschillende bronnen efficiënt kunt combineren.
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau, hiernaast ook met Data Modeling, VAULT 2.0
Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.




Voor jou:

Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Brussel) en van thuis uit.
Dynamische en maatschappelijk relevante sector: je komt terecht in een organisatie die een cruciale rol speelt in nationale en internationale connectiviteit.
Innovatie en duurzaamheid staan centraal in de bedrijfsstrategie.
Je werkt in een moderne werkomgeving met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, opleiding en samenwerking.
Snelle opstart mogelijk – we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.

Title: Insurance Data Analyst
Description:
Insurance Data Analyst

*sponsorship not provided*




Location: Brussels




Language Requirements: Fluent in Dutch or French & proficient in English (essential)




Are you passionate about turning complex data into meaningful insights that drive business decisions? This dynamic consultancy looking for a Data Analyst to join their team in the insurance sector. If you enjoy working with large datasets, uncovering trends, and supporting strategic initiatives with data-driven recommendations—this is your opportunity to make a real impact in a forward-thinking and agile business.




What You’ll Do

As an Insurance Data Analyst, you will play a key role in helping the team understand the data and transform it into actionable insights. You’ll work with cross-functional teams, apply statistical methods, and use visualization tools to communicate your findings to stakeholders at all levels.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Data Collection & Preparation:

Gather and clean data from multiple sources (databases, APIs, spreadsheets) to ensure accuracy and usability.

Analysis & Insight Generation:

Use statistical techniques to explore and interpret data, identifying patterns, trends, and correlations.

Visualization & Reporting:

Build compelling dashboards and visual reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib.

Stakeholder Communication:

Present findings in a clear, concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Strategic Collaboration:

Work with internal teams to understand business needs and deliver data-backed solutions that drive performance and growth.

Continuous Improvement:

Stay current on new technologies and trends in data analytics and bring innovative thinking to the team.




What You Bring

Proficiency in SQL and data querying techniques
Experience with Python or R for data analysis
Strong skills in data visualization and reporting tools
Solid understanding of statistics, data modelling, and data warehousing concepts
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication and presentation skills
Independent, detail-oriented, and eager to learn
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field
Master’s degree or relevant certifications are a plus
Fluency in Dutch or French, with good command of English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
As a part of the data team you will become one of the go-to persons for supporting the business with all kinds of data-related requests. Become one of our building blocks in smoothening the path towards a managed self-service environment in which the business values your support on their data roadmap.

Function


You’ll support the business with data and Power BI related questions
You’ll analyze data requests by taking into account data accessibility, availability and quality in order to determine the added value of the request.
You support the business in increasing data literacy and assist the progress of our data culture
You’ll support the business by translating raw data into clear KPIs and report requests
You’ll be responsible for creating blueprints and the necessary documentation that accompanies data objects
You’ll create proof of concepts for pilot projects to evaluate the value of new insights
You’ll be responsible for enjoying and tasting our fresh and delicious products


Your Profile


You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
You have proven work experience in a data related job (1-2 years)
You are a critical thinker and like to deep dive in large data sets
You have a passion for working with data and are eager to learn on the job
You are fluent in Dutch and English


Our Offer


You will join an international family business with a strong long-term vision, where more than 5,000 enthusiastic colleagues work together, driven by five strong values.
We invest in a happy work environment through various sports and team events.
You can literally taste our passion every day through our fresh and innovative top-quality products.
You will contribute to building a better world, as sustainability is high on our company’s agenda.
You will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a highly dynamic environment. Our LLBG Academy supports you in becoming the best version of yourself.
A competitive financial package, including one day of remote work, meal vouchers, hospitalization insurance, group insurance and 10 extra vacation days on top of the statutory leave.
You will have the space to roll up your sleeves, take initiative, and truly make a difference.

Your Profile

  • You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management
  • You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • You have proven work experience in a data related job (1-2 years)
  • You are a critical thinker and like to deep dive in large data sets
  • You have a passion for working with data and are eager to learn on the job
  • You are fluent in Dutch and English

Our Offer

  • You will join an international family business with a strong long-term vision, where more than 5,000 enthusiastic colleagues work together, driven by five strong values.
  • We invest in a happy work environment through various sports and team events.
  • You can literally taste our passion every day through our fresh and innovative top-quality products.
  • You will contribute to building a better world, as sustainability is high on our company’s agenda.
  • You will have the opportunity to grow and develop in a highly dynamic environment. Our LLBG Academy supports you in becoming the best version of yourself.
  • A competitive financial package, including one day of remote work, meal vouchers, hospitalization insurance, group insurance and 10 extra vacation days on top of the statutory leave.
  • You will have the space to roll up your sleeves, take initiative, and truly make a difference.

Title: Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Zoetis Zaventem is currently looking for a Regional Data Analyst.

As the Data Analyst at Zoetis Benelux, Nordics & Ireland, you will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business growth and innovation for the whole region.

By analysing and interpreting data trends, patterns, and anomalies, you will provide valuable insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the region, enabling data-driven decision-making and strategic planning for the regional Lead and the General Managers.

The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in building comprehensive reports and dashboards that visualize key metrics and performance indicators, empowering stakeholders to monitor progress, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions based on real-time data analysis.

Your work will directly contribute to improving processes, optimizing performance, and ultimately enhancing the overall competitiveness and success of Zoetis BNNI region.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key insights and findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop analytical solutions to address business challenges.
Conduct ad hoc analysis and research to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Stay updated on emerging trends and best practices in data analytics and continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and methodologies.
Translate analytical findings into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations for all stakeholders.

Relationships

Develop mutually beneficial long-term partnerships with local, regional and international teams based on high quality interactions and exceptional provision of service
Implement bespoke solutions for all stakeholders in the region, utilising all available resources and tools
Work effectively at all levels in the teams from Vice President, General Manager to Marketing and Sales Managers.
Contribute to the success of your team by sharing best practice with colleagues across the region and proactively introducing ideas

Compliance

Maintain high standards of business conduct and compliance, adhering particularly to Pharmacovigilance Policy, Global vet Policy, Zoetis values, travel & expenses policy and local codes of practice.

KEY SKILLS

Capability in, or potential to develop

Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and the ability to create visually compelling reports and dashboards
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract insights from complex datasets and identify actionable recommendations
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate findings to all stakeholders
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment
Strong collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver impactful solutions

BEHAVIOURS

Our Colleagues make the difference

Keep your analytical skills sharp. Train, and retrain
Be an expert on your domain - know them inside and out, and continue to learn
Use the experience from setbacks and failure to drive your future success

Always do the right thing

Sell what you know your stakeholders need; what you know will work for our business
Uphold the highest standards of professionalism, honesty and integrity with the stakeholders
Help build the reputation of our brand by understanding and supporting the things that we stand for

Customer obsessed

Know your stakeholders. Know more than just their names, know their business
Establish effective and lasting relationships with customers that build loyalty to our brand

Run it like you own it

Ground all data quality plans in commercially sound thinking
Make realistic and achievable commitments to stakeholders that work for our business whilst benefiting theirs

We are one Zoetis

Show the stakeholders a united team that speak with one voice
Give the team timely information and support that helps them to deliver their role
Know what's going on around the business and talk about it to your customers

TRAINING & QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field; advanced degree preferred
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or related role, with a minimum of 5 years of experience

EXPERIENCE

Experience in a commercial industry
Experience in a data analyst role
Professional experiences gained in industries or sectors outside of Animal & Human Health are welcomed

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Limited frequency of travel.


About Zoetis

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.
