Title: Junior BI Engineer / Data Analyst - September 2025
Description:
About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.

Get The Future You Want | https://www.capgemini.com/be-en

Your role

Data Analyst and BI Engineers are the foundation of the Data and AI profession, applying their expertise to ensure governance and management, and influencing business decisions by the stories they tell with data.

At Capgemini, this multifaceted specialism has significant experience across traditional warehousing technologies and databases, Big Data and Cloud. There is never a dull moment in this career path!

As a junior Data Analyst & Bi Engineer, you will be responsible for:


Integrate, transform and consolidate data from various structured and unstructured data systems.
Create and design data models.
Translate functional requirements into a scalable, fit-for-use technical design.
Own the delivery of data modelling and data pipelines.
Implementing a new operating model which supports innovation and acceleration through data & analytics.
Contributing data expertise to strategic projects that align with the clients goals.


Your profile

We Are Looking For Someone Who


Owns a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Data Science, Business Engineering, Computer Sciences, or equivalent.
Has strong knowledge of SQL (this is a must).
Is fluent in Dutch or French and English, but notion of other language and willing to improve.
Is geographically mobile: Although you must be ready to accept assignments anywhere in Belgium, most of your assignments will be Brussels based.
Is eligible for security clearance.


Success In This Role Often Comes Down To


Strong communication skills: You can convey complex ideas clearly and persuasively.
Teamwork: You excel at collaborating and building meaningful relationships.
Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:


A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.


Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Junior Clinical Data Analyst (BE)
Description:
CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.




Responsibilities:

Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform – diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)




Qualifications:

College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.
Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
Excellent English oral and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Experience with CDISC databases is a plus













Top Reasons to Work with Us

Flexibility is part of our DNA

Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
FREELANCE: Data-Expert met business skills




Are you a meticulous individual passionate about ensuring data quality and governance? Do you have an affinity for shaping the way information is managed and presented in today's dynamic business landscape? If the challenge of streamlining and refining both structured and unstructured data resonates with you, then our Data Steward role might just be the opportunity you're looking for!




Our client is embarking on a mission to harness the power of information. We're on the lookout for a dedicated Data Steward to steer this initiative, ensuring structured and unstructured data remains accurate, relevant, and consistent. This position goes beyond mere oversight; it involves a diverse range of responsibilities, from resolving information incidents to setting quality benchmarks, thereby integrating you with various departments across the organization.




What's in it for you?

A unique opportunity to deepen your skills in information management and governance
Thrive in a role that places you at the heart of data quality and lifecycle processes
Establish a significant and enduring impact within a large corporate
Enjoy the flexibility of 2 remote work days per week
Long-term contract and assignment




What you'll do

Champion information governance and be a pivotal voice in crucial councils
Efficiently address and rectify information incidents, upholding supreme quality standards
Dictate the rhythm of the information lifecycle, from its inception to its eventual archiving
Collaborate with a variety of stakeholders, imparting knowledge on information-centric best practices
Authenticate the integrity of the information model, managing inquiries and validations
Cultivate and enhance the internal information ecosystem




Who you are

Must-haves:

Solid experience in information management or a role of similar nature
An analytical prowess complemented by effective problem-solving skills
Proficiency in understanding information classification, its lifecycle, and overarching governance
Strong communication abilities, both in written and spoken forms, in Dutch and English
A genuine passion for continuous improvement and learning




Nice-to-haves:

An academic background in Information Management, Data Science, or related fields
Acquaintance with contemporary data tools and applications







This role is open to both freelancers and people seeking a role as a consultant on recurv's payroll. If this role excites you, don't hesitate – apply or connect with us!




Questions? Contact:

📩 buna@recurv.be

Show more

  • Organizational talent: You maintain oversight and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.
  • Problem-solving ability: You think creatively and tackle challenges proactively.


Why Capgemini?

We offer a supportive, flexible, and growth-oriented workplace where your contributions make a difference. Here’s what you can expect:

  • A hybrid work model with up to 70% remote work.
  • Access to world-class learning platforms to upskill in marketing, communications, and leadership.
  • A dynamic, fun, and collaborative marketing team.
  • A brand-new, state-of-the-art office in Diegem.
  • Competitive salary with a flex plan to customize your benefits, including a company car or mobility budget.
  • Comprehensive health and group insurance, meal & eco vouchers.
  • 32 vacation days, plus bank holidays, with options to purchase extra time off.
  • Opportunities for international exposure and travel to support exciting projects and events.


Ready to shape the future?

We'd love to hear from you if you’re passionate about communication and eager to grow in a fast-paced, innovative, and international company.

Apply today and Get The Future You Want!

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description


About Devoteam:

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise. 

For 30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.

With 11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe

At Devoteam, tech is in our DNA, and it’s the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we’re ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.


Job Description


If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications


For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information


#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mon Client Est Une Foodtech En Pleine Expansion Située à Bruxelles Et Rosière. Ils Ont Des Clients à L'international Et Pour Soutenir Leur Croissance, Il Cherche Un·e




Data Analyst




Ce poste est fait pour toi si tu adores le traitement de data et que tu souhaites te développer vers des compétences de Product Owner.




Ce Qu’on Attend De Toi

Etre 4/5 data analyst, pour garantir des données fiables, documentées, claires
Etre 1/5 product owner, pour transformer les besoins utilisateurs en specs bien ficelées, aligner l’équipe dev et piloter la roadmap.
Un bon mix entre analyse rigoureuse, communication claire, logique produit et envie d’apprendre et de faire bouger les choses.




Ton Background

Tu as 4 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst dans une société Tech.
Tu adores les chiffres autant que l’expérience utilisateur.
Tu veux un job à fort impact, dans une équipe soudée.
Tu maîtrises le français ou l’anglais pro (ou idéalement les deux !).




Ce Qu’il T'offre

Un job ultra-varié, utile et engageant dans une start-up en pleine croissance
Un salaire compétitif avec un large éventail d’avantages
Travailler dans un environnement avec un impact positif sur l’alimentation durable
Une team bienveillante et passionnée.
De vrais défis tech & produit sur un logiciel unique (nutrition, empreinte carbone, food cost, allergènes…).
Et du fun, parce que c’est comme ça qu’on avance

Prêt à relever le défi ? Postulez ici!

Title: Business Reporting Analyst
Description:
For our client, a renowned international company based in the Zaventem / Diegem region, we are currently looking for a Business Reporting Analyst.




Role




The Business reporting analyst supports the finance department as well as the senior management and management team, by structuring the business information related to the different business processes throughout the organization. He/she has the objective to coordinate and structure the different data streams to present the information in a logical, transparent, well defined and efficient way. The performance controller has accountability for the reporting environment and in this sense has to make a proper analysis of the environment and make recommendations for improvements and implement them.







Key responsibilities




She/he is responsible for the management reporting set-up within the controlling department and supports the financial reporting process from a corporate point of view in terms of providing the right data sets needed to fulfill the corporate requirements
The business reporting analyst is keen on searching to optimize the reporting process in terms of preparation and availability/access to it.
Transforming the available information streams into usable business steering information by means of transparent, structured and easy to understand management reporting
Set-up of specific standard reports in a logic presentation and including description of reporting and definition of variables, starting with a clear analysis of the reporting needs and considering corporate reporting requirements
Search for synergies within the department to streamline information delivery, optimize the reporting processes to avoid possible errors.
Assist in defining and describing the different fields used within reporting and setting up a KPI library in a structured and well-defined way. By doing this, supporting the data quality process and assuring that correct data usage is embedded within the department and organization







Requirements for the role




You hold a University degree in Economics, Finance or Management.
You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in business analysis, data analysis or corporate reporting.
Experience with Power BI, SAP BPC and/or SAS are assets.
You feel comfortable in complex and fast paced international environment.
You have experience in analyzing information needs of the business/finance and translation them in useful and fancy reporting.
You can handle situations that require analytical thinking, interpretation and judgment to continuously optimize solutions.
You are IT-savvy and are an experienced user of reporting tools.
You have strong planning & organization skills.
You are stress resistant and are able to meet tight deadlines.







Offer




Our client offers a challenging and exciting role that will allow you to make your mark. You will get the opportunity to join an ambitious company that enjoys a solid reputation in its market. The context is one of finance and business transformation, allowing people with a sense of initiative to have a real impact on the business.

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Company Description

At Publicis Groupe Belgium we are driven by the Power of One. That’s our raison d’être: to make brands relevant and interesting to people, in order to touch them and influence their behavior, to grow the business of the brands we work for. More than 200 diverse bright experts are organized in 4 interconnected métiers (strategy & data, creative experiences, media activation, and production), and are the drivers of our collective creativity. And ow, yeah, it’s “Groupe” with an “e”. With our group’s roots in la douce France you can expect loads of Liberté, Curiosité and Créativité.

Overview

In this function, you work within the fun-loving and diverse Strategy & Data team of Publicis Groupe. You will be showcasing your (lack of) music taste in multiple Spotify-playlists with your colleagues and support them in better understanding people through your knowledge and skill in qualitative and quantitative research and turning data into insight.

Comms Strategy is one of the 4 focus teams within Strategy & Data and as a Comms Analyst / Research Executive you play a central role in supporting our data science (in close collaboration with the Data Analysis-team) and market research solutions and platforms. You are also actively involved in driving innovation within our practice.

Responsibilities


You manage and optimize the day-to-day research operations of our Effects Tracking-portfolio in close collaboration with Comms Strategists
You develop interview guides, questionnaires and research plannings and conduct interviews, focus groups and online quantitative research for bespoke and standardized Publicis Groupe research solutions
Together with your colleagues in Data Analysis you oversee analysis of research results and dashboarding solutions for reporting purposes
You support Comms Strategists in getting the best out of tools like Nielsen Wizzad+, Kantar BMM, GlobalWebIndex and more
You contribute in the development of POV and research around topics relevant in media and advertising (cfr. our Summer of Sports-research project in 2024)
You collaborate with stakeholders in the Comms Strategy- & Data Analysis-teams to further explore the possibilities of our proprietary BioLogic AI insights platform


Qualifications

It is your courage, thinking and how you connect with others that makes the real difference. The role is always adapted to the personality, never the other way around. This is what matters most to us. We can teach you our methods, processes, and frameworks, but you can teach us to make them work. However, seen the central position you take; we do have a couple of requests:


This is a starter position, you are ready to launch a career in insight generation in communications
You are curious, honest, brave, generous and take ownership
You have a critical mindset, because you are committed, and want to put it to use for brands, people, and society
You have a broad field of interests and an interest in brands, marketing, and communications
You have an education that has allowed you to have a solid understanding of statistics and market research basics
You have excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
You can work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French to navigate our diverse multinational culture and environment


Additional Information

Do you believe that you can play a central role in helping us become the reference agency for the Age of Opportunity? Let’s talk!

Contact: matthias.langenaeker@publicisgroupe.be & berten.peremans@publicisgroupe.be
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

🎉 250 événements par an pour rencontrer tes collègues et des locaux feel good 📢 Des formations, conférences et une plateforme d'e-learning avec LinkedIn pour monter en compétences #greatplacetolearn 👩‍ Des Communautés Métiers et du Mentorat pour partager son expertise et en apprendre sur de nombreux sujets #greatplacetoshare 🕹️ Une communauté de e-sport : Extia Gaming ! #greatplacetoplay 🌏 Envie d’évoluer ? Grâce à notre politique de mobilité interne, explorez de nouvelles opportunités en Belgique ou dans l’un de nos 7 autres pays !


Show more
HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🤖 The Job

As a Junior Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll embark on a journey to become a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll gain hands-on experience in translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll learn to gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.




During a training period, we'll equip you with the skills you need to become a proficient Data Analyst. You'll learn to embrace a role that will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




✅ Key Responsibilities:

Assist clients in bridging the gap between business and data teams
Help translate business needs into concrete data and AI-driven requirements
Gather business requirements from clients and identify relevant data sources
Build and deploy effective data models
Crunch the numbers, deep dive into the data, spot opportunities, understand what is going on to support the decision making
Translate technical outcomes into business impact and present results to stakeholders
Contribute to developing data governance frameworks and capabilities within organisations




🎉 What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fuelled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.







🔎 The profile

You have worked for 1,5 - 2 years in the data field in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




💪 The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have a first experience (+-1,5-2 years) with data visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, as well as programming languages such as SQL, Python, and/or dbt, in a work project.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You are developing your technical ability and soft skills to align both technical and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak English fluently and either Dutch or French.







💰 The Offer

Competitive salary package with benefits including a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, high-end laptop, and smartphone.
Personal & team training budget for continuous professional development.
Innovation budget for involvement in exciting open-source projects.
Team Buildings, gatherings, and sports initiatives to foster team spirit.







Ready for a new chapter as a Junior Data Analyst at Dataroots? Great! Apply now! 🎉

Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Job Description

We are moving towards an increasingly data-driven world, with boundless possibilities. At Telenet, Data & analytics are recognized as the fuel & engine under the hood that can improve everything in our business. Within the Data Acceleration Tribe - the centralized data & analytics team in Telenet’s agile at-scale organization - our Data Strategists play a key role in shaping and executing our AI products.

Our Data Strategists are centralized and report into our Analytics & AI team. They play a key role in our so-called ‘Boost’ concept, with each individual data strategist leading the execution of one of our AI products and steering the day to day efforts of our data scientists and analysts to do so. This happens in close collaboration with business teams across Telenet (quarterly click-in mechanism with business teams) on topics such as Customer Experience transformation, Segment-of-one marketing, Value-based network roll-out, and Strategic workforce intelligence.

As a group, data strategists collaborate closely with our organization’s business - and data leadership to ensure that the work we do in data delivers value.

Your Key Roles & Responsibilities


You drive the execution of AI products to turn our data strategy into reality in close collaboration with business stakeholders, taking a leading role towards your fellow data colleagues in the topic
You provide direction by bringing clarity on WHAT the team needs to deliver and WHY this has to happen in specific macro use cases
You support topic identification and prioritization of use cases, i.e. you work closely with business leaders to identify and prioritize problems that can be solved through data & analytics
You proactively drive prioritization, ensure alignment and manage expectations with all involved stakeholders, including business stakeholder and data leadership
You proactively support, challenge, and inspire business teams by broadening their perspective and showing the possibilities that exist in the world of data
You make sure that we invest our data resources wisely and to the greatest benefit of Telenet


Your profile


You have strong business and leadership skills
A sharp understanding of how data can be used to drive the business.
Strong storyteller skills and the ability to deliver a message with impact.
Excellent negotiating and influencing skills to deal with conflicting priorities and ambiguity.
Ability to lead a group of your data colleagues (2-4) on a day to day basis to collaborate with business teams in delivering value from data
A strong background management consulting is a (big) plus, with valued skillset incl. slide writing, business cases, prioritization, project management, stakeholder management, written communication and presentation skills (pyramid principle)
You have a can-do mentality, an agile mindset and experience with dealing with change in an organization.
You speak English and Dutch fluently.
You have a Master or equal by experience, and 5-10 years relevant experience.


How we make a difference for you!

Start a new adventure in the beating heart of our data driven organization, where we work in the utmost flexible way, be it from home or from our open and trendy collaboration spots at the office, and collegiality is more than just a word. We keep an eye out for talent, ambition and eagerness to learn. We’ll coach you, train you and make you part of our story. Moreover, you’ll enjoy a wages and benefits package that will get you places. We’re talking meal vouchers, group and health insurance, a yearly bonus and discounts on Telenet products. Come experience it for yourself, our passion is contagious.

Title: Data Reporting Analyst
Description:
Freelance Opportunity: Data Reporting Specialist




Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that drive real business decisions? We’re looking for a data-savvy professional with strong Qlik experience to help shape the future of reporting and analytics in an evolving environment. You’ll collaborate across departments, build meaningful dashboards, and contribute to smarter decision-making at every level of the organization.




Your Role:

Develop insightful dashboards and reports using Qlik tailored to business priorities.
Translate stakeholder input into structured data solutions and reporting frameworks.
Validate data outputs to ensure quality, reliability, and user trust.
Guide users in the adoption and value of reporting products.
Document your work to ensure transparency and consistency across the BI landscape.
Apply ITIL and SDLC concepts in a pragmatic, real-world manner.




Your Profile:

Hands-on experience with Qlik (Sense, View or equivalent).
Strong communication skills—comfortable working with both business and technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English, with a solid command of Dutch or French.
Structured yet flexible, with the ability to work on multiple initiatives in a dynamic setting.
Enthusiastic, self-driven, and not afraid to take initiative.




For you:

Be part of a broader transformation toward a data-driven way of working
Contribute directly to how data supports decision-making across teams
Work in a forward-thinking environment that values initiative and learning
Enjoy a mix of structure and flexibility in your day-to-day tasks
See the tangible impact of your work through visible results
Collaborate closely with both business and IT stakeholders
Benefit from growth opportunities in a supportive and evolving context




Interested? buna@recurv.be

Title: IoT Data analyst
Description:
Did you know that we have more than 250.000 compressors connected to the cloud so they can be centrally monitored and proactively serviced?

The future is SMART. Smart Machines and the industrial Internet of Things keep changing the world.

The role

Do you thrive on learning something new every day? Is your ideal day one where you apply your skills in big data, signal processing, and machine learning to develop innovative solutions and business models? Then you might be the perfect fit for our team.

As an IoT Data Analyst, you'll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to deliver data-driven products and solutions across our global organization. You will leverage advanced data science techniques to transform data from our connectivity solutions into actionable insights that drive value.

Your Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret large volumes of sensor and machine data using signal processing techniques (both time and frequency domain).

Apply both supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms to derive insights from complex datasets.

Collaborate with colleagues in marketing, operations, and engineering to shape product roadmaps and develop end-to-end solutions.

Gain a deep understanding of our entire connectivity ecosystem: from physical equipment, to insights, to the value delivered to customers.

Contribute to the development of smart maintenance and performance optimization models.

Who You Are

You hold a master’s degree in engineering (Electronics, Computer Science, or equivalent).

You’re skilled in Python and/or Spark.

You have a strong interest in mechanical systems and are eager to dive deeper into the domain.

You enjoy working in diverse, international teams and are comfortable collaborating across functions.

You are a problem-solver with a passion for innovation and a drive to continuously improve.

Are we a good fit?

Atlas Copco is a Swedish company, the Swedish human culture continues to flow through the veins of our 38,000 employees in more than 90 countries. It has a strong family vibe with a warm respect for each individual and we strive for strong diversity. We also invest heavily in our customers, in the environment, ... but first and foremost in our own people. In this way, we provide a stimulating environment in which you can develop your competencies daily. In addition, our family-friendly working atmosphere gives you the flexibility to find an optimal work life balance.

Would you like to get to know us? Hope to see you soon!

Start a journey towards something greater

At Atlas Copco we believe in challenging the status quo, always looking for a better way. Our caring culture and leading-edge technology enable us to innovate for a sustainable future. With us you become part of a global community of passionate people making a tangible impact on people’s lives.

We offer a wide range of interesting job roles and many opportunities to grow. This is where it begins – Join us at the Home of Industrial Ideas.

Title: Data and Generation Forecast Analyst
Description:
afarax is looking for a freelance Data and Generation Forecast Analyst. We need you!




The project:

Our client in the utilities sector is looking for a Data and Generation Forecast Analyst to join their team.




Key responsibilities:

Support the HCM Update Process:

Acquire in-depth knowledge of the data inputs required for load and generation updates.
Conduct thorough reviews of HCM input updates to ensure accuracy and reliability.

Data Management and Archiving:

Work collaboratively with the scenario data management project lead to define best practices for data storage and archiving.
Support the department through changes to improve data accessibility and reliability.

Automation and Process Improvement:

Participate in proof of concept (POC) initiatives for integrating new data versions from Distribution System Operators (DSO).
Analyse current workflows and propose requirements for enhancing the automation of the HCM update process.

Technical Support and Collaboration:

Assist team members in managing and manipulating data efficiently, utilizing tools such as Python.
Collaborate with external data professionals to translate business needs into technical requirements.




Is this you?

Master's degree in engineering, with a strong foundation in data management.
Proficiency in data manipulation, with practical experience in Python.
Fluent in English, with proficiency in Dutch or French.
Familiarity or readiness to learn additional tools like R, PowerBI, and Databricks.
Deep understanding of electrical engineering concepts, including energy, power, and reactive power.
Ability to proactively address and solve technical challenges with an entrepreneurial mindset.
Demonstrates a strong sense of responsibility and professionalism.




How afarax supports you?

You benefit from our extensive network
You will have access to projects that fit your expertise
We help and support you throughout your project
We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

  • We help and support you throughout your project
  • We offer the possibility to build a valuable and lasting partnership

Check out more projects on: https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Title: Senior Analyst Report
Description:
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Analyst – Reporting to provide analytical support and ensure accurate, high-quality reporting to meet business needs. This role involves interpreting complex data, optimizing data quality, and delivering insightful reports while ensuring compliance with governance standards. You will work closely with stakeholders to refine reporting requirements and drive automation initiatives.

Key Responsibilities


Produce and manage detailed reports, ensuring data accuracy and timely distribution.
Communicate reporting needs, clarify requests, and validate results with stakeholders.
Standardize reports and oversee automation processes in line with company standards.
Identify and resolve data inconsistencies, optimizing data quality and integrity.
Analyze trends, detect recurring issues, and propose process improvements.
Develop complex calculations and simulation models for in-depth data analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal guidelines.
Prioritize internal reporting needs and oversee functional validation (UAT) of reports.
Provide support in creating user guides and educating stakeholders on governance rules.


What You Bring


Education: Bachelor's or Master’s degree.
Experience: At least 3 years in reporting, data analysis, or business intelligence.
Languages: Strong proficiency in English and a second national language.


Technical Skills


Advanced data processing and analysis capabilities.
Strong understanding of business data and operational challenges.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and office applications.
Knowledge of project management principles.


Why Join Us?


Be part of a dynamic team driving data-driven decision-making.
Work on impactful projects that improve reporting efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.


If you have a passion for data, reporting, and process optimization, we’d love to hear from you!

#Analyst #reporting #LandmarkGlobal #bpostgroup

Title: Research Executive
Description:
Company Description

At Publicis Groupe Belgium we are driven by the Power of One. That’s our raison d’être: to make brands relevant and interesting to people, in order to touch them and influence their behavior, to grow the business of the brands we work for. More than 200 diverse bright experts are organized in 4 interconnected métiers (strategy & data, creative experiences, media activation, and production), and are the drivers of our collective creativity. And ow, yeah, it’s “Groupe” with an “e”. With our group’s roots in la douce France you can expect loads of Liberté, Curiosité and Créativité.

Overview

In this function, you work within the fun-loving and diverse Strategy & Data team of Publicis Groupe. You will be showcasing your (lack of) music taste in multiple Spotify-playlists with your colleagues and support them in better understanding people through your knowledge and skill in qualitative and quantitative research and turning data into insight.

Comms Strategy is one of the 4 focus teams within Strategy & Data and as a Comms Analyst / Research Executive you play a central role in supporting our data science (in close collaboration with the Data Analysis-team) and market research solutions and platforms. You are also actively involved in driving innovation within our practice.

Responsibilities


You manage and optimize the day-to-day research operations of our Effects Tracking-portfolio in close collaboration with Comms Strategists
You develop interview guides, questionnaires and research plannings and conduct interviews, focus groups and online quantitative research for bespoke and standardized Publicis Groupe research solutions
Together with your colleagues in Data Analysis you oversee analysis of research results and dashboarding solutions for reporting purposes
You support Comms Strategists in getting the best out of tools like Nielsen Wizzad+, Kantar BMM, GlobalWebIndex and more
You contribute in the development of POV and research around topics relevant in media and advertising (cfr. our Summer of Sports-research project in 2024)
You collaborate with stakeholders in the Comms Strategy- & Data Analysis-teams to further explore the possibilities of our proprietary BioLogic AI insights platform


Qualifications

It is your courage, thinking and how you connect with others that makes the real difference. The role is always adapted to the personality, never the other way around. This is what matters most to us. We can teach you our methods, processes, and frameworks, but you can teach us to make them work. However, seen the central position you take; we do have a couple of requests:


This is a starter position, you are ready to launch a career in insight generation in communications
You are curious, honest, brave, generous and take ownership
You have a critical mindset, because you are committed, and want to put it to use for brands, people, and society
You have a broad field of interests and an interest in brands, marketing, and communications
You have an education that has allowed you to have a solid understanding of statistics and market research basics
You have excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
You can work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
You are fluent in English and Dutch and/or French to navigate our diverse multinational culture and environment


Additional Information

Do you believe that you can play a central role in helping us become the reference agency for the Age of Opportunity? Let’s talk!

Contact: matthias.langenaeker@publicisgroupe.be & berten.peremans@publicisgroupe.be
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pourquoi vous choisirez AG

Un lieu de travail où vous pouvez prendre des initiatives. Où vous pouvez être la meilleure version de vous-même. Où on vous encourage à vous développer. Et où vous construisez l’avenir avec vos collègues. Vous avez de l’audace et le client est au centre de vos préoccupations ? Alors, à très bientôt chez AG !

Au sein du département Customer Digital Foundation, l'équipe Financial, referential & digital Method est chargée de stocker, d'améliorer et de maintenir les données de tous nos clients et intermédiaires, de gérer les processus et outils financiers centraux et de définir et implémenter les processus digitaux pour nos clients finaux




Et si c’était votre prochain job ?

Une part importante des activités consiste à participer au développement de la vision de demain concernant nos clients :

Centraliser toutes les informations disponibles sur les clients et les mettre à la disposition de tous les utilisateurs et des processus AG.
Soutenir et développer les projets My AG. Notre objectif ? Fournir une plateforme permettant à nos clients finaux de visualiser et de modifier leurs propres données et préférences.
Élaborer et améliorer les processus et outils transversaux afin d'obtenir une vue d'ensemble du client dans toutes les business lines. Il s'agit notamment de la mise en place d'un 360° client, de la reconnaissance de la téléphonie, de l'authentification des clients sur les plateformes numériques...
Elaborer et améliorer les process et outils transversaux liés aux activités financières du client ( paiements, recettes, recouvrement,…)
Uniformiser, stocker et gérer de manière centralisée les données et préférences des clients.
Compléter et améliorer les données existantes sur les clients.




En outre, afin de supporter cette vision et ce, nous devons également réaliser un ensemble d’activités liées à la data quality de nos données clients et cherchons un data analyst pour nous supporter dans ces initiatives:

Exploiter et analyser des ensembles de données complexes pour obtenir des informations pertinentes. (Utilisation de Python pour la manipulation, l'analyse et la visualisation des données. Rédiger et optimiser des requêtes SQL pour extraire et analyser des données à partir de bases de données relationnelles.)
Vous exploitez le potentiel d'utilisation des données externes dans le cadre des processus et des activités du business.
Créer des ensembles de données nécessaires pour de nouvelles analyses et assurer leur cohérence et leur exactitude. Mettre à disposition les rapports récurrents.
Travailler de manière prospective en mettant à disposition des outils de reporting en libre-service pour les parties prenantes et en favorisant une culture de l'autonomie en matière de données.
Vous contribuez avec le département informatique à garantir l'industrialisation des solutions dans notre système, en respectant les exigences du business, en assurant entre autres les livraisons liées aux exigences, le suivi et les activités de test.
Se tenir informé des tendances de l'industrie et des technologies émergentes pour améliorer continuellement les capacités de data science.
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec nos clients internes pour comprendre leurs besoins et fournir des solutions basées sur les données.
Collaborer étroitement avec l'IT pour définir et valider les exigences en matière de données (disponibilité et qualité) et pour mettre en œuvre des solutions répondant aux besoins du business.
Vous assurez le suivi du projet, communiquez avec les supports appropriés aux différentes parties prenantes et aux différents niveaux de management sur l'état d'avancement, les réalisations, les risques, etc.




Vous vous reconnaissez dans ce profil ?

Vous avez un Master dans une filière quantitative (statistiques,data sciences, mathématiques, informatique, économie, commerce) ou un domaine connexe où l'analyse de données joue un rôle prépondérant.
Vous avez de l'expérience en gestion de projet, en analyse de données, en business intelligence ou en analyse business.
La connaissance de SQL ou d'autres compétences en matière de données est un avantage.
Connaissance des plateformes de données telles que Databricks.
Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et un sens critique aiguisé
Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données tels que PowerBI.
Solides compétences en analyse de données et en modélisation statistique.
Vous savez faire preuve de créativité.
Réfléchir en termes de processus ne vous pose aucun problème.
Vous avez d'excellentes capacités de communication, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit.
La qualité est essentielle à vos yeux.
Vous aimez collaborer (au sein de l'équipe et au-delà).
Sens de l'initiative et proactivité sont autant de cordes à votre arc.
Vous vous exprimez correctement en français et néerlandais et connaissez l’anglais.




Vous n'allez pas rater ça ?

Vous bénéficiez d'un package salarial comprenant plusieurs avantages. Vous voulez des avantages supplémentaires (voiture en leasing, congés supplémentaires ou assurances) ? Vous pouvez faire votre choix !
Votre bien-être est primordial. C'est pourquoi AG mise sur un programme bien-être sportif, inspirant et accessibles pour toutes et tous.
Des horaires flexibles ? Travailler à domicile jusqu'à trois jours par semaine ? Chez AG, c'est possible.
Vous avez la possibilité de vous développer sans cesse. Grâce à notre large éventail de formations, vous apprendrez tous les jours de nouvelles compétences. Boostez-vous, et boostez votre carrière !
Changer de fonction au sein d'AG ? C'est élargir sa zone de confort. Et ça aussi, c'est possible chez AG. Votre carrière, votre choix.
Vous rejoignez un environnement de travail à la fois dynamique et durable. Nos bureaux laissent le champ libre à la collaboration et à l'épanouissement personnel.




Partez à l'aventure !

Vous vous y voyez déjà ? Appuyez le bouton et postulez dès aujourd’hui. Nous nous ferons un plaisir de vous aider si vous avez besoin de soutien avant ou pendant le processus de sélection.

Show more

Title: Senior Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a PowerBI consultant, you will help our clients solve complex BI issues. You collect data from different sources,build sustainble datamodels, optimize datasets for reporting and develop user-friendly PowerBI dashboards. Based on your own expertise and the Sopra Steria BI methodology, you increase the quality of reporting and visualization at our customers. In addition, your input will contribute to the vision and development of our Data Visualization team.

Understanding data is important. With the Sopra Steria solution for Data visualization, we help organizations do just that. We do this by visualizing information and data. We make abstract information accessible and understandable. Based on the right insights, we can then make data driven decisions about next actions Microsoft technologies such as PowerBI, Fabric, Azure, ... hold no secrets for us.

Within our Data Visualization team we want to help each other and keep learning from each other. We do this by working closely together within the team. So are you looking for new challenges with great colleagues and a steep learning curve? Then the Data Visualization team at Sorpa Steria is the right place for you.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have at least 3 year of experience with data visualization and can demonstrate this with a demo or portfolio
You have at least 3 year demonstrable experience with PowerBI
You have experience with performance tuning of PowerBI solutions
You dare to be creative, but do not lose sight of the details
Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles
You act as an expert and coach people
You communicate fluently, both with your colleagues and the customer
A good knowledge of data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts..
Knowledge of HTML/CSS and programming languages such as javascript, python, C# is also a plus
Data visualization is your passion
Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application is a plus
Knowledge of exernal tools like Tabular editor are a plus
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

  • You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus

What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
  • The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Senior Data Analyst Consultant
Description:
Tasks

Lead and deliver complex client assignments, ensuring quality assurance and guiding consultants in their daily tasks
Assist clients in addressing their most pressing data and regulatory challenges, including credit, risk, finance, client, and ESG regulations
Analyze data to derive valuable insights and take ownership of implementing solutions while measuring their effectiveness in partnership with the client
Build and nurture strong client relationships, including training junior consultants and engaging with senior client management
Facilitate post-delivery meetings to assess project value and performance, ensuring continual client satisfaction
Lead proposal processes end-to-end and ensure successful project completion
Support Senior Managers and contribute to the development of practice value propositions and directors during key meetings




Benefits

Dynamic and challenging environment to start your career in Financial Services
Opportunity to work on a wide range of complex and rewarding projects for prestigious clients within the banking industry
We promote internal knowledge sharing, a dedicated Risk and Regulatory Academy, external courses and professional certification programs (e.g., FRM, PRM)
We invest in the development and progression of our people to maximise their potential
We are a non-hierarchical organisation and promote openness, teamwork and knowledge sharing within the firm and the Reply Group
We offer a competitive base salary alongside a benefits package including bonuses to reward performance




Qualifications​

At least 3 years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst
Masters Degree or equivalent in Finance, Economics, Business Management, Business Engineering or other relevant field of studies
Fluent in English as well as able to speak either Dutch or French
You have advanced proficiency in SQL and/or Python
You possess solid expertise in data manipulation, analysis, cleansing, extraction, transformation, loading, and visualization techniques
You have experience working with data tools such as Collibra, Mega Hopex, MicroStrategy, Dataiku, Qlik, Power BI, and Tableau
You have an interest in AI and a strong understanding of data-related concepts such as data quality, metadata, and Master Data Management







About Avantage Reply

Avantage Reply, part of the Reply Group, specialises in Financial Services consulting with a focus on Governance, Risk and Finance Transformation, Treasury and Capital, Quantitative Modelling, Compliance and Regulatory Advisory. With offices across Europe, we count some of the world’s most significant financial groups among our clients, including in Investment, Retail and Commercial Banking, Custodian Banking, Insurance and Investment Management.
