Title: Data Scientist / Analyst
Description:
CLEEVEN, a technology consulting firm, was built on two strong convictions:

The excellence of European engineers must ensure global competitiveness

Our human mission: to support our employees in their personal development.




As part of a strategic project with one of our Swiss clients in the pharmaceutical sector, we are recruiting a Data Scientist / Data Analyst (M/F) with a background in life sciences (pharmacy, biology, medical devices...) to support the teams in the collection, analysis, and interpretation of health data related to the development of new components and medical devices.




Role and responsibilities:

Work closely with R&D, clinical, and quality teams to structure and analyze data from preclinical and clinical studies
Analyze health-related data (efficacy, tolerance, side effects…) to support medical and regulatory decision-making
Design statistical or machine learning models to extract insights from domain-specific data
Ensure data quality: cleaning, structuring, and documentation of datasets
Build dashboards and reports to communicate results to non-technical stakeholders
Contribute to the preparation of technical documentation for regulatory submissions




Expected skills:

Excellent command of data analysis tools: Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn...), R, or SAS
Strong understanding of regulated environments (GxP, pharmacovigilance, medical devices...)
Experience working with biomedical or clinical databases
Knowledge of data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, matplotlib, etc.)
Ability to translate complex analytical results into actionable insights for medical or regulatory teams
Experience in pharma, biotech, or medtech environments is a strong plus




Profile:

Engineering degree, Master’s or PhD in pharmacy, biostatistics, data science, or related field
Prior experience in data science or analytics applied to healthcare
Strong analytical skills, scientific rigor, and autonomy
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work cross-functionally (medical, data, IT teams)
Fluent in English, German and French are a big plus
Valid administrative situation to work in Switzerland




See you soon,

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Title: Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente (w/m/d) 80% - 100%
Description:
Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente (w/m/d)

Arbeitspensum: 80% - 100% / Arbeitsort: Rotkreuz

Jetzt bewerbenWas ist dir bei der Arbeit wichtig? Mitgestaltung? Selbstverwirklichung? Sinn? Ausgleich? Herausforderung? Das alles bekommst du bei Mobility. Denn bei uns heisst es nicht Arbeit, sondern: MORK – more than just work. Als Pionierin des Carsharings haben wir Erfahrung mit «Welt verändern». Willst du die Verkehrswende in der Schweiz und den Weg von Mobility mitgestalten? Dann bewirb dich auf diese neugeschaffene Stelle als Data Analyst:in Kundensegmente und stärke Mobility mit deinem Antrieb.

Deine Aufgaben


Du bist im Bereich Kundensegmente für den Aufbau und die Weiterentwicklung von Kundennutzungs- und Performanceanalysen zuständig.
Du erkennst und analysierst Muster in der Nutzung und entwickelst einen algorithmischen Zuteilungsraster in Kundensegmente anhand erkannter Merkmale (z.B. Nutzungsvorlieben, demografische Merkmale etc.).
Du entwickelst Methoden und Instrumente zur Abbildung von Kennzahlen, Trends und Prognosen in Zusammenhang mit den Kundensegmenten.
Du erstellst (Entscheidungs-) Grundlagen für die Entwicklung und Optimierung von Massnahmen (z.B. Kampagnen, Usability- oder Produktanpassungen etc.) zur zielgerichteten Bearbeitung der Kundschaft.
Du schaffst die Grundlagen zum Monitoring der Wirksamkeit einzelner Massnahmen (Measure – Learn).
Du verantwortest die datenorientierten Analysen und Monitorings des Produkt-Kunden-Fits und Integration der Erkenntnisse in Methoden und Prognosen.
Du unterstützt in der Analyse der aktuellen und zukünftigen Mobilitätsbedürfnisse in der Schweiz.
Du arbeitest eng mit dem Team Data Analytics zusammen.


Das bringst du mit


Du bringst mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit, idealerweise im Mobilitätsbereich, Verkehr und/oder im Segmentmanagement / Kundendatenanalyse.
Du verfügst über eine höhere Ausbildung auf Stufe Fachhochschule oder Hochschule mit Schwerpunkt im Bereich Datenanalyse oder Produktmanagement oder vergleichbare Berufserfahrung.
Du bist neugierig in die Bedürfnisse von aktuellen und zukünftigen Kund:innen einzutauchen Expert:in für Wissen über Mobilitys Kundschaft zu werden und somit einen Beitrag zur nachhaltigen Mobilitätszukunft zu leisten.
Du erkennst Nutzungs- und Kundenpotenziale, hast einen stilsicheren Umgang mit internen und externen Daten inkl. Kenntnisse von Datenquellen sowie der Kombination von mehreren Datenquellen.
Wenn du Erfahrungen mit Geodatenanalyse mitbringst, ist das von Vorteil.


&quotMobility entstand vor über 25 Jahren mit viel Innovationskraft. Heute kannst du in der Abteilung Produkte und Kundensegmente dazu beitragen, dass die nach wie vor aktuelle Idee von Carsharing sich weiterentwickelt. Die vielfältigen Kundenbedürfnisse und digitalen Anforderungen bringen dabei stets spannende Herausforderungen mit sich.&quotSeraina Marti, Teamleiterin Produkt Management

Wir bieten

Beteiligung am Unternehmensgewinn, an den ÖV-Reisekosten, Übernahme des Handy-Abos, die Nutzung vom Carsharing zu vorteilhaften PreisenBeitrag zu einer nachhaltigen und sinnstiftenden Geschäftsvision leisten und eigene Ideen aktiv einbringen5 Wochen Ferien, bis zu 16 bezahlte Feiertage, 16 Wochen Mutterschafts- und bis zu 4 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub als auch hervorragende SozialversicherungsleistungenFlexwork: eigenständige Gestaltung von Arbeitszeit und -ort, 40-Stundenwoche bei einem 100% Pensum – entsprechende Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf, auch dank TeilzeitarbeitMobility als Arbeitgeberin

Durch Wertschätzung und Respekt geprägt – das ist Mobility als Arbeitgeberin. Dabei sind unsere Mitarbeitenden unsere Kernkompetenz, welche wir aktiv fordern und fördern. Wir stellen hohe Anforderungen und unterstützen individuell mit gezielten Massnahmen, damit die täglichen Herausforderungen eigenverantwortlich und engagiert erledigt werden können. Mitunter trägt die einzigartige Unternehmenskultur ihren Teil dazu bei, dass Mitarbeitende mit Freude ihre Arbeit verrichten. Lass dich vom Mobility-Spirit überzeugen und leiste deinen Teil zu einer sinnstiftenden Geschäftsidee. Begeistert und neugierig auf mehr?

Bei Fragen helfe ich gerne weiter.

Chantal Notz,

Human Resources

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Vigier Rail ist der führende Betonschwellenhersteller für die Schweizer Bahninfrastruktur. In unserem Werk in Müntschemier produzieren wir seit über 70 Jahren Bahnschwellen für unsere Kunden in der Schweiz und der ganzen Welt. Qualität, Funktionalität und Langlebigkeit stehen dabei immer im Mittelpunkt. Insgesamt beschäftigen wir rund 90 Mitarbeitende aus den verschiedensten Fachgebieten: Bei uns können Sie Ihre Kompetenzen einbringen!

Was Sie tunexpand_more


Verantwortlich für die Erstellung diverser Statistiken, Dashboards und Visualisierungen – vor allem mit Excel und ggf. weiteren Tools
Mithilfe beim monatlichen Reporting für die Unternehmensleitung
Unterstützung verschiedener Fachbereiche durch datenbasierte Erkenntnisse
Aktive Mitwirkung bei der Verbesserung von Prozessen und der Datenqualität
Diverse administrative Tätigkeiten sowie Projekte


Was Sie mitbringenexpand_more


Abgeschlossenes oder laufendes Studium in Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbares Studium (HF/FH/Universität)
Freude am Arbeiten mit Zahlen, Daten und Analysen
Sehr gute Excel-Kenntnisse (inkl. Pivot- Tabellen, Formeln, Diagramme etc.)
Interesse daran, Zusammenhänge zu erkennen, zu hinterfragen und zu erklären
Analytisches Denkvermögen sowie eine strukturierte und genaue Arbeitsweise
Selbständig, zuverlässig und teamorientiert
Muttersprache Deutsch oder Französisch, sehr gute Kenntnisse in der anderen Sprache


Was wir bietenexpand_more

Eine attraktive Einstiges- und konzerninterne Entwicklungsstelle in einem dynamischen Marktumfeld. Nebst einer fundierten Einarbeitung erwartet Sie ein motiviertes Team sowie fortschrittliche Anstellungsbedingungen in einem modernen Unternehmen. Die Stelle ist befristet bis Ende März 2026.

Interessiert Sie diese Herausforderung? Zusätzliche Einzelheiten zur Unternehmung und den Aufgaben erfahren Sie telefonisch von Herr Luca Scheggia, Controller, unter der Telefonnummer 079 590 47 76.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen über unsere Online-Stellenplattform: www.vigier.ch

Ihr Kontaktexpand_more

person

HR-Beraterin

phone+41 58 909 28 58

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You’re fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines – data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & Data – empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.


We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Statistician
Description:
Statistician

3 Month contract

Part time

Hybrid - Neuchâtel




We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Statistician to lead the development and execution of a Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) for a retrospective study. The role involves extracting relevant data from an established registry and performing predefined analyses according to the SAP. This includes descriptive statistics, survival analysis, comorbidity scoring, and regression modeling.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop a Statistical Analysis Plans (SAP) in alignment with the study protocol.
Extract and prepare data from a pre-existing patient registry for analysis.
Conduct descriptive analyses
Develop and apply multivariable regression models and conduct sub-group analyses as specified in the SAP.
Ensure quality control of extracted data and analytical outputs.
Present and interpret results for internal and external stakeholders, and contribute to scientific publications.




Qualifications:

Master’s or PhD in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Experience working with retrospective study designs.
Demonstrated ability to write and implement Statistical Analysis Plans.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R, SAS, or Stata.
Strong knowledge of survival analysis, regression modeling, and epidemiological measures (incidence and prevalence).
Excellent analytical, communication, and reporting skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.




If you are interested please apply or send your CV to luke.sandilands@cpl.com

Show more

Title: Research Internship – Data Analyst
Description:
The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansjörg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.

Your Responsibilities


Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.


Your profile


Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.


Information on your application

Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.
Show more
HTML:
The Wyss Zurich Translational Center (Wyss Zurich) is a joint accelerator of the ETH Zurich and the University of Zurich, which was made possible by a generous donation from the Swiss entrepreneur and philanthropist Dr. hc. mult. Hansjörg Wyss. Wyss Zurich brings together some of the world's leading experts to form multidisciplinary teams, pooling their knowledge and expertise and the Recolony project is at the forefront of immune research in cancer.

Your Responsibilities

  • Conduct literature reviews and analyze quantitative research data.
  • Curate, wrangle and integrate biological and clinical datasets.
  • Work with OMICS data from NGS, metabolomics, proteomics to extract meaningful insights.
  • Implement, test and optimize methods such as Variational Autoencoders (VAE).
  • Perform advanced neural network and statistical analyses using PyTorch, Python and R.
  • Generate a scientific report and documentation based on your research findings.
  • Collaborate with an interdisciplinary research team and participate in ongoing research.

Your profile

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Data Science, Biostatistics, or a related field.
  • Strong background in biological or clinical data analysis, and quantitative research.
  • Proficient in Python, with experience in data science (PyTorch) and machine learning.
  • Comfortable working with OMICS data, including NGS, metabolomics, and proteomics.
  • Knowledge of command-line tools and Linux-based workflows is plus.
  • Ability to work independently while seeking guidance when necessary.
  • Strong scientific communication skills and ability to write structured reports.

Information on your application

Please submit your application as one PDF file, including a motivation letter, your CV including relevant achievements and degrees, and available references.

Title: Intern Data Analyst Customer Satisfaction 80 - 100% (f/m/d)
Description:
Share this job



The Opportunity

Are you passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer satisfaction? We are offering a six-month internship focused on developing innovative solutions for improving customer experience. Join our team and contribute to a project that will enable organizations to systematize and prioritize customer experience improvement initiatives.

How You'll Make An Impact


Conduct data reviews and perform gap analysis to evaluate the structure, quality, and completeness of current datasets
Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives
Analyze the accuracy and maturity of current datasets and propose methods to test and validate the framework
Lay the foundation for future predictive models
Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders


Your Background


Currently enrolled in a Master's program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
Good in Python or R for data analysis
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team



More About Us

Our diverse and inclusive work environment encourages collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring that every team member has the opportunity to grow Join us and be part of a company that is shaping the future of sustainable energy solutions.

Apply now

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID:17116

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas
Description:
Job Title:

Quantitative Analyst, Power & Gas

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

To support the growth in complex trades being executed by our Power and Gas trading desks, we are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to work within our Structuring and Valuation team.

This role is based in London.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop valuation models of complex trades
Work with Trading to validate the appropriateness of model assumptions
Understand model limitations and model risk
Articulate intuition regarding model outputs
Provide insight into trading strategies and asset optimisation
Generate trade ideas and assist with deal structuring
Support Origination and investment decisions
Contribute to the team’s pricing library with high-quality code
Perform ad-hoc market analyses as required to support decision making
Develop reports and visualisation tools



Key Requirements


3-5 year’s experience working as a Quantitative Analyst
Degree in a highly quantitative subject, ideally to doctoral level
Understanding of probability, statistics, stochastic calculus, option pricing theory and numerical analysis
Programming experience, ideally in Python
Knowledge of European energy markets
Experience modelling energy assets, including renewables and weather derivatives
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to explain complex mathematical concepts
Desire to work as part of a team as well as being self-driven
Fluent in English



If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst
Description:
We are working with an established and well renowned commodities trading client who are looking for a Senior Quant Analyst to join their Geneva team.




You'll be joining a desk that specialises in European Power and Gas Trading and work in a company that has a collaborative structure and give people the autonomy to impact company and personal performance.




This role is based in central Geneva and full relocation can be provided for the successful candidate.




Key responsibilities

Developing visualisation tools and reports
Developing the valuation models for complex trades
familiarity with model risk and limitations

Proficient programming skills, preferably in Python

Skilled at conveying complex mathematical concepts in a clear and understandable manner

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Data
Description:
Help build the world’s most advanced multimodal dataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset, spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond, will power the training of the world’s most capable AI frontier models, pushing the boundaries of scale, performance, and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models. We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience.

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributing to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who:


Are passionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities.


Responsibilities


Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.
Embody our culture and values.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
OR equivalent experience.
Experience using data processing technologies for Multimodal dataset scalability, parellel processing, data handling, streaming/batch processing, etc.
Experience working with distributed computing tools such as; Spark, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, Flink and Pyspark.
Experience conducted research in Machine Learning or worked as an ML Engineer/ MLOps/ SWE.
Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.


Preferred


Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

  • Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.

Preferred

  • Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Engineering Intern
Description:
Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineering Intern in Zürich, where you will have the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals and contribute to innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this internship, you will gain hands-on experience with modern data technologies and help set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

What to Expect in Your First 6 Months

Month 1-2


Get familiar with Sika’s data architecture, technology stack, and main data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign).
Shadow team members to understand daily workflows and best practices in data engineering.
Support the team with basic data extraction, data entry, and documentation tasks.
Get certified in different technologies such as Azure, Databricks and dbt.


Month 3-4


Learn to use key data engineering tools such as Azure Databricks, dbt, and Azure Data Factory through guided tutorials and hands-on exercises.
Assist in maintaining and updating simple ETL/ELT pipelines under supervision.
Help monitor data quality and perform basic data validation checks.


Month 5-onwards


Support teammates in preparing data for analytics and reporting use cases.
Help create and update documentation, templates, and user guides for data processes.
Participate in troubleshooting sessions and learn how to resolve common data pipeline issues.
Continue to build your skills by attending internal workshops and collaborating on small-scale data projects with guidance from mentors.


Qualifications


Recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, or a related field; Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.
Strong interest in data engineering and analytics; relevant coursework or project experience is a plus.
Familiarity with programming languages such as SQL and Python; knowledge of PySpark or dbt is an advantage.
Interest in cloud platforms and services (e.g., Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory); prior experience is a plus but not required.
Familiarity with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub is a plus.
Eager to learn about domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluency in English; proficiency in additional languages is a plus.


Additional Information

To find out what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to receiving your direct online application.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.







Qualification Path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Business Intelligence & Data Specialist 100% (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen Menschen mit Begeisterung für richtig gute Technik. Die mit Leidenschaft das beste Erlebnis für unsere Kunden schaffen. Menschen, die etwas bewegen wollen. Wir suchen Menschen wie dich. Let's Go!




Deine Aufgaben

Wir suchen per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung Unterstützung in unserem Business Intelligence Team.




Du definierst gesamtheitlich die Strategie des Business Intelligence und wie wir unsere Datenlandschaft strukturiert gestalten möchten
Du verantwortest internen und externen BI-Projekte, einschliesslich Anforderungsanalyse, Stakeholder-Management, Datenmodellierung, Visualisierung und Dokumentation
Du versorgst alle internen Abteilungen mit den notwendigen Daten und stellst sicher, dass wir eine umfassende und automatisierte Self-Service Reporting Landschaft erreichen
Du initiierst Massnahmen zur Verbesserung der Datenqualität
Du baust solide Monitorings für unsere Reportinglandschaft auf und behebst entsprechend Fehler eigenverantwortlich




Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Statistik, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich
Du verfügst über Berufserfahrung als Business Intelligence und Data Specialist und bringst mehrjährige Erfahrung im Umgang mit Daten, Google Cloud, SQL-Datenbanken sowie den Tools Tableau und Looker Studio mit. Idealerweise konntest du bereits erste Kenntnisse in LookML sammeln.
Du verfügst über ein solides Business-Verständnis, mit dem du Business-Requirements analytisch erfassen und in eine zielgruppengerechte Visualisierung überführen kannst.
Deine Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sind hervorragend und du kannst auf verschiedenen Ebenen und mit verschiedenen Anspruchsgruppen umgehen
Du verfügst über sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch




Über uns

Wir bei MediaMarkt glauben, dass Arbeit und Spass zusammengehören. Deshalb erwarten dich bei uns ein toller Teamspirit, ein abwechslungsreiches Arbeitsumfeld und neuste Elektronik. Wir sind überzeugt davon, dass du am besten bist, wenn du dich selbst sein kannst. Wir wertschätzen Vielfalt und begrüssen daher alle Bewerbungen - unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Religion/Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität. In unserem Markt bieten wir unseren Kunden eine riesige Auswahl an Elektroartikeln und ein einmaliges Einkaufserlebnis. Hier leisten wir an unseren 44 Standorten täglich unseren Beitrag dazu, Media Markt zu dem zu machen, was es ist: Die Nummer eins der Elektrofachmärkte in Europa.




Wir bieten

Multinationale Teams & vielseitige Aufgaben
25 Tage Urlaub & Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Mitarbeiterrabatte & Fitness
Wertschätzung & Teamspirit
Home-Office Möglichkeit




Bereit gemeinsam zu wachsen? Let's Go!

Show more

Title: Expert for data analysis and processing
Description:
Mission

In this joint position between the Center for Imaging and CIME, you will serve the EM community for exploiting measurements made on the electron microscopy platform. You will identify bottlenecks for data analysis in electron microscopy and create robust image and data analysis pipelines for typical CIME workloads

Main Duties And Responsibilities


Support EPFL researchers for electron microscopy data analysis
Analyse the needs for data processing workflows of the EPFL’s EM community
Implement (possibly ML/AI-driven) data analysis pipelines within EM imaging
Contribute to the research and development of new data analysis techniques and workflows in EM
Acting as a bridge between the CIME and the Center of Imaging.


Profile


Master or PhD in Science (Physics, Materials Science, Chemistry, Computer Science).
Expertise in the following fields/techniques :
Large scale data analysis
Development of data processing techniques/workflows
Quantitative Imaging
Experience in machine learning, AI etc.

We offer


Excellent working conditions in a dynamic multi-disciplinary environment
Possibility to increase your competences and extend your horizon.


Informations

Contract Start Date : to be discussed

Activity Rate : 100,00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year, possibly renewable

Reference: 1560

For additional information: Please contact M. Marco Cantoni by e-mail: marco.cantoni@epfl.ch

Title: Data & Research Assistant
Description:
📚 Data & Research Assistant (Remote – Based in Switzerland)

Support Smarter Decisions. Power Research with Precision. 🧠📊

📍 Location: Switzerland (Remote-first)

🕒 Job Type: Full-time / Part-time

🌍 Work Mode: 100% Remote (must reside in Switzerland)

🧭 About Us

We’re a data-driven organization operating in [insert sector – e.g., education, tech, sustainability, healthcare], and we believe that great decisions come from great insights. We're seeking a curious and organized Data & Research Assistant to join our team and help us gather, clean, and analyze the information that fuels our strategy.

🎯 What You’ll Do

You’ll be at the foundation of our research and data projects—gathering information, managing databases, and helping turn data into knowledge.

Your responsibilities will include:

🔎 Conduct online research, literature reviews, and data collection from public and internal sources
🧹 Clean, organize, and validate datasets for analysis
📊 Assist in analyzing survey results, spreadsheets, and reports using tools like Excel, Google Sheets, or Python
📝 Summarize findings in clear, well-organized reports or slide decks
💡 Help visualize trends and insights with basic charts and graphs
🗂️ Maintain organized records of research sources, data files, and methodologies
📅 Provide administrative support for ongoing research projects, including scheduling and documentation
✅ You Might Be a Great Fit If You…🎓 Are studying or have a degree in Social Sciences, Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Business, or a related field
🧰 Are comfortable using Excel, Google Sheets, and optionally Python, R, or SQL
🧠 Love learning, spotting patterns in data, and digging into details
✍️ Write clearly and can summarize findings in a logical, structured way
💬 Speak and write fluent English (other languages like German or French are a plus)
🏡 Live in Switzerland and enjoy working independently in a remote team
🌟 Why You’ll Love Working With Us🕊️ 100% remote work with flexible hours
📚 Training and mentorship opportunities
💻 Tech allowance to support your home office setup
🚀 A chance to contribute to impactful research projects from day one
🧩 A collaborative, low-ego team that loves curiosity and clear thinking
🧳 Optional team meetups in Switzerland and across Europe
📬 How to ApplySend us your CV and a short message about a research or data project you’ve worked on—what tools you used, what you learned, and why you enjoyed it. Bonus points if you attach a writing sample or simple spreadsheet/dashboard you created!

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.
Show more

Title: DataScience Research Intern
Description:
Job Location

GENEVA BUSINESS CENTER

Job Description

As a Data Scientist Research intern, you will create and adopt AI solutions and reach and proof how they will change outcomes.

Key Responsibilities:


Directly contribute to the design and development of scaled Data Science algorithms and AI products.
Work with Product, Data and Software Engineering teams to scale propositions
Analyze and understand usage and adoption to identify opportunities
Quantify the impact of these AI solutions.


Job Qualifications


Demonstrates depth of applied IT skills.
Excellent communication skills to work across multi-skilled organizations
Scientific thinking and background to formulate research questions, design experiments and execute these.


Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000131798

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Business intelligence and data analytics specialist
Description:
Referenznummer 65997

Über uns

Bucher Municipal AG ist ein weltweit führender Hersteller von Kommunalfahrzeugen zur effizienten Reinigung von öffentlichen und privaten Verkehrsflächen. Das Produktangebot umfasst Kompakt- und Grosskehrfahrzeuge, Kanalreinigungsfahrzeuge, Winterdienstausrüstungen, Müllfahrzeuge und Digital Services.

Zur Unterstützung der Geschäftsentwicklung und des Wachstums unserer Division durch datenbasierte Geschäfts- und Marktanalysen suchen wir dich als Business intelligence and data analytics specialist / 50-60%.

Diese vielseitigen und verantwortungsvollen Aufgaben möchten wir dir übertragen:


Geschäfts- und Marktanalysen, Marktforschung und Intelligence
Datenbasierte Erkenntnisse, z.B. aus CRM- und CXM-Systemen zur Unterstützung von Entscheidungsprozessen und Geschäftswachstum
Sammlung und Verwaltung von Marktdaten
Entwicklung von Business-Intelligence-Tools, KPIs und Dashboards sowie deren Leistungsmessung und Administration
Unterstützung bei der Nachfragegenerierung und Erweiterung der Vertriebspipeline
Verwaltung von CXM-Systemen sowie Anwenderunterstützung und Durchführen von Schulungen


Deine Qualifikationen:


Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich Data Science und/oder Business Intelligence und Analytics
Erfahrung mit MS Dynamics 365 CRM- und ERP-Modulen, Microsoft Power BI und Power Automate sowie Kenntnisse in CX-Systemen
Englischkenntnisse sind zwingend erforderlich, weitere Sprachen, insbesondere Deutsch, sind von Vorteil
Teamorientierte Persönlichkeit mit einer selbständigen und exakten Arbeitsweise


Deine Perspektiven:

Möchtest du Teil eines engagierten, professionellen und hilfsbereiten Teams werden? Wir bieten dir eine interessante Herausforderung in einem globalen, erfolgreichen und innovativen Industrieunternehmen. Gute und faire Anstellungsbedingungen sind für uns selbstverständlich. Zudem ist dein zukünftiger Arbeitsplatz mit den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln (Bus oder S-Bahn ab Baden und Zürich) sehr gut erreichbar. Zusätzlich stehen unseren Mitarbeitern kostenlose Parkplätze und für die Verpflegung ein Personalrestaurant zur Verfügung.

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns darauf, dich bald kennen zu lernen!

Lukas Büchi, Human Resources Director, freut sich über deine vollständige Bewerbung mit Bezug auf die Referenz 65997 an PERSONAL.CH@BUCHERMUNICIPAL.COM
Show more

Title: Consultant - Forensic Technology and eDiscovery
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (“AI”) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity


The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (“GenAI”), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.


Your Key Responsibilities


Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have


Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and “can-do” approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you’ll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more

Title: Stagiaire - BI Analyst - 6 mois
Description:
Job Description

Vous êtes actuellement en cours de formation dans une université/haute école dans le domaine Informatique / Finance et recherchez un stage pour valider votre cursus (avec convention de stage).

MISSIONS



Concevoir et développer des dashboards interactifs sur Power BI afin d’optimiser le suivi de l’activité.
Automatiser des workflows et optimiser les flux de données via des solutions no-code.
Collaborer avec les gestionnaires de portefeuille pour comprendre leurs besoins en reporting et en analyse.
Assurer la qualité des données et l’ergonomie des interfaces développées.



PROFIL



Vous êtes actuellement étudiant(e) en Informatique, Data Science, Finance, ou tout autre domaine pertinent.
Capacité à comprendre les enjeux financiers et à traduire les besoins métiers en solutions BI.
Maîtrise de Power BI : création de tableaux de bord, DAX, gestion des sources de données.
Sens du design et de l’expérience utilisateur (UX/UI).
La connaissance de Power Apps est un plus.
Une expérience (stage, projets scolaires/personnels) dans un domaine similaire est requise.
Autonomie, rigueur et esprit analytique.
Show more

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit




Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Show more
